en.title: Republic Day (India)
en.desc: Commemorating the adoption of the Constitution of India.

hi.title: गणतंत्र दिवस (भारत)
hi.desc: भारत के संविधान को अपनाने के उपलक्ष्य में।

en.title: Independence Day (India)
en.desc: Celebrating India's independence from British rule.

hi.title: स्वतंत्रता दिवस (भारत)
hi.desc: ब्रिटिश शासन से भारत की स्वतंत्रता का जश्न।

en.title: Defence Day
en.desc: Marking the sacrifices of the armed forces.

hi.title: रक्षा दिवस
hi.desc: सशस्त्र बलों के बलिदान को चिह्नित करते हुए।

en.title: Gandhi Jayanti
en.desc: Marking the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.

hi.title: गांधी जयंती
hi.desc: महात्मा गांधी की जयंती के उपलक्ष्य में।

india.en: Supreme Court to review key constitutional amendments.
india.hi: सुप्रीम कोर्ट प्रमुख संवैधानिक संशोधनों की समीक्षा करेगा।

india.en: Parliament passes a landmark bill on digital privacy.
india.hi: संसद ने डिजिटल गोपनीयता पर एक ऐतिहासिक विधेयक पारित किया।

world.en: United Nations discusses historical treaties and modern borders.
world.hi: संयुक्त राष्ट्र ने ऐतिहासिक संधियों और आधुनिक सीमाओं पर चर्चा की।

world.en: A rare copy of the Magna Carta is displayed at a global exhibition.
world.hi: मैग्ना कार्टा की एक दुर्लभ प्रति वैश्विक प्रदर्शनी में प्रदर्शित की गई है।

en.question: Which topic are you most interested in this week?

hi.question: इस सप्ताह आपकी किस विषय में सबसे अधिक रुचि है?

facts.en: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists found 3000-year-old pots still edible.
facts.hi: शहद कभी खराब नहीं होता। पुरातात्विक खुदाई में 3000 साल पुराना शहद भी खाया जा सकता था।

facts.en: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
facts.hi: केले बेरी होते हैं, लेकिन स्ट्रॉबेरी नहीं।

aries.en: A good day for new beginnings.
aries.hi: नई शुरुआत के लिए अच्छा दिन है।

caption.en: Nature’s beauty captured in one frame.
caption.hi: प्रकृति की सुंदरता एक तस्वीर में।

en.name: Ola Cabs
en.desc: Ride-hailing giant with plans to diversify into EVs and logistics.

hi.name: ओला कैब्स
hi.desc: राइड-हेलिंग कंपनी जो ईवी और लॉजिस्टिक्स में विस्तार की योजना बना रही है।

en.name: Zomato
en.desc: Zomato started as a simple food review website in Gurgaon. Founder Deepinder Goyal struggled with scaling the business, faced multiple funding rejections, and fierce competition from international players. With persistence and innovation, Zomato grew into India's leading food delivery giant and became one of the first tech unicorns to go public.

en.name: Zoho
en.desc: Zoho was built quietly outside the limelight without any external funding. Founder Sridhar Vembu, working from a village in Tamil Nadu, focused on product quality and long-term sustainability. Despite struggling to compete against global giants, Zoho grew into a global SaaS leader with millions of users worldwide.

en.name: Byju's
en.desc: Byju's started as offline coaching classes in Kerala before moving into digital learning. Founder Byju Raveendran worked tirelessly to transform his teaching methods into an ed-tech platform. The company saw rapid growth, attracting global investors, but later faced scrutiny over losses and governance challenges.

en.name: Physics Wallah (PW)
en.desc: Physics Wallah began as free YouTube classes by Alakh Pandey. Coming from a modest background, he struggled with resources but focused on delivering affordable quality education. With loyal students and innovative teaching, PW became India’s only profitable ed-tech unicorn at the height of the funding winter.
